page.title: 20HISTORICAL EVIDENCE
page.content: Fragments of{neolithic flint}have been found at Atley,now Treleigh,in the south and Hustyn.{Triangular and leaf {arrow heads and scrapers }have been identified.There is a{barrow}and other stones at Hustyn Down and a{tumulus } at Penhaligon.About 60/80 A.D. the {Romans}built a{fort},now just a rectangular field,for a cavalry group to watch the ford,where an ingot of tin was found.For 600 years Boscarne Manor was the home of the Flamanks,who probably came with William in 1066. Thomas Flamank was executed with 'An Gof' for the rebellion of 1497 against Henry's taxes.A rich lode stretches from Dunmere to Mulberry but mining ventures finished by about 1860.The railway of 1834 was one of the first built.
